intro: Myrsine novocaledonica subsp. boulindaensis, commonly known as the Boulinda myrsine, is a shrub native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
